intro: Polyscias oahuensis, commonly known as Oahu nettle or Oahu soursop, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its limited range, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
